intro: Anthephora elongata, commonly known as the long-stalked anthephora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a somewhat waxy texture. Anthephora elongata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
